Gain 12 (15) **Block** :p_block:.

embeds.title: Manifest
embeds.description:
Common Skill / 2 :energy_hermit:  / The Hermit / Downfall

Gain 16 (20) **Block** :p_block:.
Add a Decay to your hand.

messages.content: Manifest is 8(10) block per energy spent, whereas this is 12(15) block. They both generate a curse, and impending doom can technically be played around or activated intentionally when you over-block.
oh yeah, here's <impending doom>

embeds.title: Impending Doom
embeds.description:
Curse / Downfall

**Unplayable**.
**Dead On:**
At the end of your turn, deal 13 damage to EVERYONE.

messages.content: it goes to the very right of your hand
Does that dead on activate smoking barrel?
idk, but it is activated by <concentrate keyword>

embeds.title: Concentration
embeds.description:
Keyword / Downfall

The next Dead On card played while Concentrated triggers its effect regardless of position. Wears off on turn end.

messages.content: which is hehe funny
<Snipe> also works with it

embeds.title: Snipe
embeds.description:
Uncommon Skill / 0 :energy_hermit:  / The Hermit / Downfall

 **Concentrate** :p_concentration:.)
Your next **Dead On** effect this turn triggers twice.
**Exhaust**.

messages.content: which is really funny

not a big fan of this card. It has good block value for one energy, but the curse is really debilitating unless you have spefically selected multiple curse synergy cards. 13 damage to all enemies can sometimes help finish off fights, but most of the time taking 13 damage yourself is a trade you cannot do unless you just win the fight with that last pit of damage. Drawing impending doom in the middle of your turn can get really bad if you also draw it alongside a status card and are left with 3 cards (which if you play you also take 13 damage you probably cannot block)

12 block for 1 energy is very efficient. This is a very solid front-loaded block option for short and medium length fights. Important to note that the curse is added to the far right of your hand, so it will basically never trigger and deal 13 damage to you unless you want to deal the 13 damage to everything else as well. It's actually pretty difficult to make impending doom go off on the turn you play midnight even if you want it to, you would usually need multiple card draw spells. Adding the curse to your hand has synergies with final canter and spite, as well as with clasped locket and shadow cloak once you reshuffle your draw pile. Do be careful in longer fights if you have none of these synergies, as the impending doom will just be a dead card to weigh you down later on, and it will be possible to draw it in a bad position and trigger the dead-on when you don't want to.

Midnight is in a slightly awkward spot next to its competition, since cards like dive, ghostly presence, and vantage all have beneficial effects over the course of a longer fight (and can trigger smoking barrel), while midnight is usually going to make your deck worse on the 2nd cycle. Coalescence can be really nice to line up big turns or play sources of rugged on the right turn, and hole up is excellent with determination, virtue, or orange pellets. A lot of the time, there will just be better block cards available to you, or block cards that have better synergies. Midnight becomes more premium when you have curse synergies and can mitigate/benefit form the added curse.

Midnight can be a good pickup in act 2, where you really need efficient block cards to deal with frail and big attacks from the hallway/elite fights. It will really start to suffer in acts 3 and 4, unless you find the curse synergies to go with it. The upgrade is nothing special, never a priority, I think it could afford to be a +4 given that impending doom is usually a downside. Quite bad with runic pyramid.
Yeah upgrade is a little low, it's multiplied by 1.25
I think mist cards average being like 1.35-1.4 times as high
And then empty fist is 1.56 times when upgraded
yeah but that's empty fist
leap upgrade is x4/3
strike upgrade is x1.5 lmao
also feel no pain is x1.25, but it does not need more at all
speaking of impending doom, hermit act 3 boss is still too easy
even if you ignore the super common blue candle event

Standard upgrade in my mind is a +3 to damage/block based on strike and defend (for 1 energy cards), as well as many commons. Some cards like dagger spray, twin strike, or deadly poison end up having better upgrades because it's not possible to give them a traditional +3. Other cards like backstab, wild strike, or conclude get more than a +3 because of the downsides they have, which I think also applies to midnight.

Empty fist is just silly to me, a +5 is totally unwarranted, and on top of that, exiting your stance is an upside most of the time (getting the energy back from calm, not taking double damage from enemies by leaving wrath, divinity is a nonbo, but rarely worth pursuing anyways. Gaining block from mental fortress, pulling back flurry of blows, etc.) But then again, most people agree that watcher is completely unbalanced. That's not even mentioning that the +5 becomes a +10 assuming your deck is fairly good at entering wrath, which most watcher decks will be.
Idk why empty fist is the way it is
